Units.Unit_Name: Provide Knowledge On Structure And Replication Of Dna
Topics: DNA Structure - Salient features of double helix, forms of DNA.
Denaturation and renaturation.
DNA topology – Supercoiling, linking number, topoisomerases.
DNA organization in prokaryotes, eukaryotes.
Replication of DNA in prokaryotes and eukaryotes - Bidirectional and unidirectional replication, semi-conservative and semi-discontinuous replication.
Mechanism of DNA replication – enzymes involved – DNA polymerases, DNA ligase, primase.

Units.Unit_Name: Significance And Functions Of Rna In Protein Synthesis
Topics: Transcription in Prokaryotes.
Concept of transcription.
RNA Polymerases - prokaryotic and eukaryotic.
General transcription factors in eukaryotes.
Translation in prokaryotes and eukaryotes - Translational machinery - ribosome structure in prokaryotes and eukaryotes, tRNA structure and processing.
Inhibitors of protein synthesis in prokaryotes and eukaryotes.
Overview of regulation of gene expression - lac operons as example.

Units.Unit_Name: Cause And Types Of Dna Mutation And Dna
Topics: Mutation - Definition and types of mutations.
Physical and chemical mutagens.
Reversion and suppression.
Uses of mutations.
Repair Mechanisms - Photoreactivation, Nucleotide Repair, Base Excision Repair, Methyl Directed Mismatch Repair and SOS Repair.

Units.Unit_Name: Outline The Role Of Plasmids And Phages
Topics: Plasmid – Structure, types, replication, plasmid incompatibility, plasmid amplification and curing of plasmids.
Bacteriophage-T4 Phage – Structure and lifecycle, Lambda phage-Structure, Lytic and Lysogenic cycle.
Applications of Phages in Microbial Genetics.

Units.Unit_Name: Examine Mechanisms Of Gene Transfer And Recombination
Topics: Gene Transfer Mechanisms - Conjugation and its uses.
Transduction - Generalized and Specialized, Transformation - Natural and Artificial Transformation.
Transposable elements - Prokaryotic transposable elements – insertion sequences, composite, and non-composite transposons.
Transposition and Types of Transposition reactions.
Mechanism of transposition: Replicative and non- replicative transposition.
Uses of transposons.

course_outcomes.2: Illustrate the types of RNA and protein synthesis machinery.
course_outcomes.3: Infer the causes and types of DNA mutation and summarize the DNA repair mechanisms.
course_outcomes.4: Evaluate the importance of plasmids and phages in genetics.
course_outcomes.5: Analyze gene transfer and recombination methods.
